title: 4 Easy Ways to Add a Resume to Your LinkedIn Profile

steps.title: Go to the Jobs tab.
steps.content: Go to the Jobs tab. You can do this by clicking Jobs at the top of the screen on LinkedIn's webpage.

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . It's on the left-hand side of the page, with an icon of three lines next to it.

steps.title: Click Resumes and application data.
steps.content: Click Resumes and application data . It's under the My qualifications heading.

steps.title: Click Upload resume.
steps.content: Click Upload resume . This button is under the Share resume data with recruiters heading. You don't need to have this setting toggled on to upload a resume. LinkedIn accepts .doc, .docx, and .pdf files that are up to 5MB in size for a resume.

steps.title: Find a job listing you want to apply for.
steps.content: Find a job listing you want to apply for. You can search for job listings by clicking the Jobs header, or by searching for a company directly and finding job listings on their page.

steps.title: Click the Easy Apply button.
steps.content: Click the Easy Apply button. If the listing says Apply instead of Easy Apply , you will have to apply on that employer's website instead of on LinkedIn.

steps.title: Fill out any required fields.
steps.content: Fill out any required fields. Each job application will be slightly different, so follow the on-screen instructions to fill out the required fields.

steps.title: Click Upload resume under the "Resume (optional)" header.
steps.content: Click Upload resume under the "Resume (optional)" header. Note that if you're currently not logged in to LinkedIn, you will be required to upload a resume. Resumes must be in a .doc, .docx, or .pdf format. LinkedIn recommends that the file size of your resume is 2MB or less.

steps.title: Click Submit application.
steps.content: Click Submit application . Your resume will be sent along with your application to the employer. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find a job listing you want to apply for.
steps.content: Find a job listing you want to apply for. You can search for job listings by clicking the Jobs header, or by searching for a company directly and finding job listings on their page.

steps.title: Click the Easy Apply button.
steps.content: Click the Easy Apply button. If the listing says Apply instead of Easy Apply , you will have to apply on that employer's website instead of on LinkedIn.

steps.title: Fill out any required fields.
steps.content: Fill out any required fields. Each job application will be slightly different, so follow the on-screen instructions to fill out the required fields.

steps.title: Choose a recently used resume under the "Resume" header.
steps.content: Choose a recently used resume under the "Resume" header. LinkedIn will store up to four of your recently uploaded resumes, and you can choose between these resumes when you apply for a job.

steps.title: Click Submit application.
steps.content: Click Submit application . To use this resume again, simply apply for another job and select it by repeating the steps above. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. You can do this by clicking your profile picture at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Click Add profile section.
steps.content: Click Add profile section . This button is under your name and user picture.

steps.title: Expand the Recommended section.
steps.content: Expand the Recommended section. It's the second section, between Core and Additional .

steps.title: Click Add featured.
steps.content: Click Add featured . It's the top option on the list.

steps.title: Click the plus sign button.
steps.content: Click the plus sign button. It's across from the Featured header on the page.

steps.title: Upload your resume.
steps.content: Upload your resume. According to career coach James Pak, uploading your resume as featured media to your account will put it near the top of your page so anyone viewing your LinkedIn profile can see it. Note that the resume uploaded to your profile cannot be used to apply for jobs. To use a resume that can be used in job applications, follow one of the above methods.
